title: PSA: If your laner frantically pings "danger" when you gank, do not gank
body:
Laners, generally speaking, are whiny bitches(not as whiny as junglers,  duh. But you know, still) who would like you to gank them 4 times in first 5 minutes.

If they ping you not to do this, they sure as hell have good reason to.

I'm always confused when a jungler tries and ganks for me when I'm at really low health, and they even spam pings.

It's like...what do you expect me to do? Sacrifice myself to get an extra ability off?
Just rub your liver hole on them.

A similar thing happened in my last game.

I was playing Brand against a LeBlanc. I was doing pretty well, out csing her and zoning her away from my minions by W>E and spreading my flame to her. 

Every time she wanted to trade I would E her then q her as she dashed to me, stunning her. I would then W and walk away, I wouldnt be unscathed but I would always force a passive burn and a back. 

After buying a negatron cloak it was even easier to bully her, keeping the lane pushed and keeping her from roaming. 

However one time I brought her low and she left, their half health Elise came from top to gank me. I saw her coming a mile away and E Q stunned her as soon as she cocooned me, then LeBlanc blinked over to try to help. 

I threw my ult into their midst then flashed away.

I got a double kill. I went on to carry our struggling top lane and got a victory through attrition.

The moral of the story is never gank a Brand with his ult up while he has mana and you have low health, even if you have some CC.

sometimes you can bait the other laner into a exchange in which would be in their favor normally and turn it into a kill or at the very least evening the lane so you won't lose as much for or gives you a chance to recall and reset the a lane yes even when you're low hp. Depending on the champions in lane and jungler its  a  mater of risk vs reward.

Sometimes sacrificing yourself is the right play  although you may not become a the fed player some junglers or mids if they are roaming can gain a monstrous lead with a few kills. however it's usually true you can't trust anyone in Solo Q because everyone believes they have to carry a game.

Or they opposite, if a jungler or another lane pings you not to push because an enemy is near. Do. Not. Push.

a gank isnt always for a kill. a gank can be to relieve press off of the laner. if i see my mid is getting pushed/zoned and have limited hp / mana i might just half-ass gank to make the enemy laner back off or if lucky they panic and blow a summoner spell. it might make them be a bit more passive in lane which would allow my team mate a chance to catch up on the gold or cs or a chance to back to heal. people too often think a gank has to be for a kill which isnt true. 

another example lets say drag is up and its on your bot side where as jungler you can get your bot lane to help it is typically easier to secure with 3 then 2. so i would gank in order to make the enemy bot lane back to turret if not base, burn a summoner. now in this gank you arent diving hard, or trying to blow anything of yours you just wanna make pressure so the enemy has to back. in this moment of time it will allow your bot lane to rotate with you to take a drag. now if the gank go more in your favor and you can get a kill then great but make sure you are still able to have the hp/mana smite ect to secure the objective you wanted. 

kills in game are ideally windows that allow you time to take objectives, dragon, rift herald , baron, turrets, inhibs. by getting a kill you get gold. experience which gets you ahead to allow you to be stronger to making taking objectives easier. but a successful gank isnt always one that results in a kill.

I'll often gank an aggro laner as Gragas and hold my flash so that my flash being up still pressures them into backing off a bit.

If they don't back off, I kill them!

I consider any of the following a successful gank:
1. We got more kills than we gave up (obviously)
2. We forced the enemy off their turret long enough to destroy it (also obvious)
3. Enemies used more summoners than we did (ults can count here too, but only if they are important long CD ults, not Leblanc or Anivia)
4. Enemy was forced to back at a time that caused them to lose farm/pressure

Equivalent summoner trades may or may not be a success, depending on the situation.

However, I still agree with the OP's point: all of the above are far less likely to happen if the laner doesn't join you.  And if they warn you that they're not going to, don't go in alone anyway and then blame them for doing the thing they told you they were going to do.  That's as toxic as it is dumb.

i dont disagree with your 4 points. i never said anything to the nature of being dumb/toxic or anything related to that. i simply was pointing out facts that there are more then a cookie cutter black and white "sucessful gank"
